intro: Alepidocline annua, commonly known as annual alepidocline, is an annual flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in well-drained soils. Alepidocline annua is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
